* Technology leaders, staying ahead of industry trends and emerging technologies to drive innovation.


**Additional Information**
 This is a full-time position with a placement in Stockholm!
   

  

**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future. Read more about us here
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  

**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  

 We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.
   

  

**Qualifications**
**Additional Information**

title: Sales Executive - New Business - PSO
description:
Meet Unit4, a fast-paced, game-changing SaaS company revolutionizing ERP for scale-ups, mid-market organizations, and category leaders. We’re not just rewriting the rules of enterprise software; we’re tearing up the old playbook. For 40 years, the ERP industry has been bogged down by clunky, legacy systems, and we’re here to shake things up.
   

  

  

  

 At Unit4, we’re all about transformation. We empower ambitious businesses with cutting-edge ERP solutions that are adaptive, intuitive, and self-driving—designed to free organizations from the mundane and help them focus on what truly matters. Our mission? To turn work into something more meaningful while helping our customers achieve their greatest potential. Want to learn more about how we’re reshaping the future? Head to our website and see how we’re helping businesses thrive.
   

  

  

  




**Job Description**

 We’ve got an exciting opportunity, to join our high-energy, fast-growing sales team. If you’re a natural hunter, a born deal-closer, and someone who thrives in fast-paced environments, this is your chance to shine.
   

  

  

  

 As a New Business Sales Executive, you’ll play a critical role in driving digital transformation for scale-ups, mid-market organizations, and category leaders in the Professional Services sector. Your mission: sell Unit4’s ERP Financial and HCM solutions, win new logos, and help our clients unlock their true potential.
   

  





  

  

*This is a hybrid role based out of our Stockholm office.*




 What You’ll Do
   

  




* Craft and execute a killer new business sales strategy to hit ambitious targets in the Professional Services vertical.
* Qualify leads like a pro and engage key decision-makers with a consultative, value-driven approach.
* Own complex sales cycles from start to finish, orchestrating cross-functional teams—pre-sales, value engineering, marketing, and more—to close big deals.
* Deliver powerful, results-oriented presentations to C-level execs, focusing on their core challenges and the Office of the CFO.
* Help prospects see the business impact of our solutions, turning skeptics into believers.
* Stay ahead of the curve by mastering our tech and keeping up with industry trends


**Qualifications**
* You’re a go-getter with at least 3-5 years of experience selling complex SaaS solutions.
* You have a proven track record in ERP
 
 or SaaS sales (mandatory).
* You’re a pro at navigating the Professional Services sector and understand its unique needs.
* Business processes? You know them inside and out.
* You have the charisma to inspire, the resilience to negotiate, and the vision to guide clients toward success.
* You’re a team player with a hunter’s mindset, always looking for that next big win.
* You’re comfortable engaging and influencing C-level executives, turning tough challenges into bold opportunities.
* Mentorship, leadership, and collaboration come naturally to you—you’re always ready to lift others while driving results.


**Additional Information**

 Why Unit4?
   

  





  

  

 At Unit4, we believe in big ideas, bold action, and breaking barriers. Here’s what sets us apart:
   

  




* Freedom to Thrive: We trust you to own your role and drive success, offering autonomy and flexibility.
* Uncapped Time Off: Take the time you need to recharge—your well-being matters.
* Global Wellbeing Days: When we say “switch off,” we mean it. We all take time to prioritize health and balance.
* Next-Level Talent: Collaborate with some of the sharpest minds in the software industry.
* Purpose-Driven Impact: Be part of our Act4Good program, where innovation meets sustainability to make the world better.
* Inclusive Culture: We’re committed to diversity, equity, and belonging through our Employee Resource Groups like Women at Unit4, Pride at Unit4, and Mental Health & Access at Unit4.



 This is your chance to join a company that’s as ambitious as you are. If you’re ready to disrupt the status quo and make a real impact, let’s talk.
   

  

  

  

 Ready to take the leap? Apply now and let’s make work better, together.

title: Head of Solution Support
description:
GlobalConnect is one of the leading connectivity providers in Northern Europe. We’re 2000 passionate and talented individuals who want to make a difference, turning our customers’ visions into reality through connectivity. Our goal is to create the best possible conditions for engaged employees, a place where you can develop and grow, and create unforgettable memories and enjoyable experiences.
   

  

 We have helped develop and digitize societies across the Nordics for more than two decades. Our purpose is what drives us to continue - turning visions into reality by empowering society with connectivity.
   

  

*Do you want to shape a function that connects Sales and Delivery in our growing datacenter business?*
 We are now hiring a Head of Solution Support to take ownership of this key function. You will lead a small team, define roles and responsibilities, and serve as the link between Sales and Delivery. Your focus will be on early involvement, clear alignment, and solutions we can deliver. You’ll report to the Senior Director of Site Operations and be part of the leadership team.
   

  

 At GlobalConnect, Site Operations handles the daily operations and transformation of datacenter sites, co-location facilities and Points of Presence (PoPs) across the Nordics and northern Germany. Demand is growing, and we are expanding our infrastructure through both near-term solutions and major build-out projects.
   

  

**Strategic Leadership**
 You will build and formalize the Solution Support function within Site Operations. The role is key to align sales with delivery across our datacenter operations and ensuring consistency for both Carrier and B2B customers. It also plays an active role in the integration of Site Operations into a unified Plan-Build-Run model.
   

  

* Formalize the function’s scope within Site Operations
* Set up clear processes for early delivery involvement and solution signoff
* Align solution offerings with datacenter infrastructure including capacity and operational capabilities
* Standardize product descriptions and documentation across Nordic markets
* Drive the function’s role in the ongoing organizational transformation, including how we support internal tools like the customer portal


**Team Leadership**
 The team exists, but the function is not yet fully formed. Your role is to shape a group of individuals into a cohesive, structured team with a clear purpose.
   

  

* Lead a team of 4+ people working with sales support, product coordination and contract administration, and eventually expanding the team to provide pan Nordic support.
* Define how the team operates within Site Operations & connect the team’s work to business goals.
* Take an active role in customer cases and delivery projects when needed


**Vendor & Service Coordination**
 You will oversee vendors, services, and internal handovers to ensure smooth delivery of datacenter solutions.
   

  

* Leverage potential in Remote Hands and Cross Connect products to increase revenue
* Align vendor and supplier setup with Procurement and Contract Management and invoicing with Finance
* Manage onboarding of customer solutions and recurring services


**To Succeed In This Role, We Believe You Have**
* Relevant Leadership experience in infrastructure or datacenter services in the IT & telecom sector
* Experience orchestrating solution design, presales involvement and delivery handover
* Proven experience leading teams or functions in a technical or operational setting
* Fluency in English. Nordic language skills are a plus


*You don’t need to send a personal letter unless there’s something in your background that isn’t already covered in your CV or LinkedIn profile.*

title: Senior Solutions Engineer
description:
**Job Summary**
 As a Senior Solutions Engineer, you determine customer needs for solutions and services from NetApp. You analyze customer requirements and convert them into technical solution concepts. You can present NetApp technologies to customers at different levels of responsibility, adapt to the interlocutors and question their motives and motivational factors. You not only support sales in the first technical customer discussions but are also responsible for the technical elaboration of the solutions offered.
   

  

 Your area of responsibility
   

  

 Your area of responsibility includes the technical representation of NetApp and in particular the analysis of existing cloud, IT, network, application, backup and storage landscapes at customers. In the role of a Trusted Advisor, you are responsible for developing solution concepts and architectures, which you will present to a larger audience as part of a technical customer presentation. Active contact with customers in cooperation with the responsible Client Executive and ensuring that technically complex inquiries are handled competently and implemented professionally are the focus of this task.
   

  

 Your Profile
   

  

 Are you enthusiastic about innovative technology and would you like to constantly develop yourself?
   

  

 Do you find it easy to explain complex issues and do you find yourself in the following points?
   

  

* Interest in current trends in IT and technologies used (e.g. public clouds, hybrid clouds, container technologies, DevOps concepts, artificial intelligence)
* High motivation to actively advise our customers on their path to digital transformation and to develop joint solutions
* You can think analytically, are creative and team-oriented
* You like to bring different people together and work towards a common goal
* IT knowledge, including in enterprise/cloud computing, virtualization, storage, backup or high availability solutions
* Knowledge of storage technologies is desirable
* Successfully completed technical training or technical studies with appropriate professional experience
* Very good knowledge of Swedish and English Language


 At NetApp, we embrace a hybrid working environment designed to strengthen connection, collaboration, and culture for all employees. This means that most roles will have some level of in-office and/or in-person expectations, which will be shared during the recruitment process.
   

  

 At NetApp, we embrace a hybrid working environment designed to strengthen connection, collaboration, and culture for all employees. This means that most roles will have some level of in-office and/or in-person expectations, which will be shared during the recruitment process.
   

  

**Equal Opportunity Employer**
 NetApp is firmly committed to Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) and to compliance with all laws that prohibit employment discrimination based on age, race, color, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, religion, disability or genetic information, pregnancy, and any protected classification.
   

  

**Why NetApp?**
 In a world full of generalists, NetApp is a specialist. No one knows how to elevate the world's biggest clouds like NetApp. We are data-driven and empowered to innovate. Trust, integrity, and teamwork all combine to make a difference for our customers, partners, and communities.
   

  

 We enable a healthy work-life balance. Our volunteer time off program is best in class, offering employees 40 hours of paid time per year to volunteer with their favourite organizations. We provide comprehensive medical, dental, wellness, and vision plans for you and your family. We offer educational assistance, legal services, and access to discounts. Finally, we provide financial savings programs to help you plan for your future.
   

  

 If you want to help us build knowledge and solve big problems, let's talk.

title: Director of Product Management (w/m/d)
description:
At Trackunit, we believe great product leadership stands on two legs: a deep understanding of product and business context, and the ability to grow and empower the people who bring it to life. As our new Director of Product Management, you’ll lead across all three dimensions that matter: people, business, and customers. 
 



 You’ll be joining a distributed, high-impact team and will play a critical role in shaping how we build and scale our product organization — with a strong focus on people leadership, customer value creation, cross-regional collaboration, and technical credibility.
 



 With hubs located in several vibrant cities across Europe, we offer a flexible setup that allows you to work from one of our local hubs or remotely from anywhere within the EMEA region. You can find the full overview at the bottom of this job ad or by visiting this link. Please note that we do not offer relocation assistance for this position.
 


 What’s in it for you?
 * A place in an
 **agile growth SaaS business** 
 , with possibilities to grow internally in the company. We are moving quickly, so fasten your seat belt and prepare to adjust. Back in 2020 we were 150 employees at Trackunit and we have just passed 450 employees.
* International environment with regular check-ins and social events across teams, departments and borders.
* We take your
 **personal and professional development** 
 goals seriously and we support them through training, coaching and mindfulness as well as with an open feedback culture to enable you to identify your strengths and opportunities. We do this by touching upon your impact on our triple focus: impacting yourself, impacting teams/relations and impacting the organisation/strategy.
* **Flexibility and hybrid working is not just a cliché** 
**to us** 
 or something we state in a job posting. We do offer you a flexible setup and believe that you best can structure how your routines look like. And once you have chosen how you work best, let us know what you need: we got you covered with the IT equipment you need for your work.
* **Turning the Tide** 
**.** 
 At Trackunit, we aim to create and contribute to an inclusive workplace. And this priority starts with our hiring - we do not discriminate on the basis of gender identity, sexual orientation, personal expression, ethnicity, religious belief, or disability status. We only assess candidates on their qualifications and merit. Learn more about TIDE and other DE&I initiatives here.


**Who are you** 
**ideally** 
**?** 

 We’re looking for someone who brings a strong combination of product and people leadership — someone who thrives in complexity, builds bridges across regions, and empowers product teams to deliver commercial outcomes. You ideally:
 


* Have cross-regional experience leading distributed product teams in a B2B SaaS context.
* Think in systems and can define and evolve product operating models — not just product roadmaps.
* Bring executive-level communication skills: You’re able to influence senior stakeholders and align across teams on complex trade-offs and priorities.
* Possess strong product and commercial acumen: You understand how product decisions drive business results — and vice versa.
* Have high credibility with technical teams and can facilitate sound trade-offs without undermining delivery.
* Have led through ambiguity and brought clarity to messy, fast-moving environments.
* Build high-performing teams by mentoring, shaping career paths, and driving a strong culture of feedback, ownership, and continuous improvement.
* Operate beyond product — partnering with peers across Engineering, GTM, and executive leadership to drive execution at scale.



 Don't meet every single requirement? No worries — this is what we’re looking for ideally. If you're drawn to this role but your experience doesn’t align perfectly, we encourage you to apply.
 


**Primary responsibilities:** 

**Product & Business Leadership** 



* Own and evolve how we build and launch products, bringing structure and momentum to a growing product area.
* Translate business strategy into actionable product direction, driving measurable outcomes tied to commercial success.
* Shape the product operating model and ensure cross-functional alignment across Engineering, Design, and GTM.
* Build strong relationships with stakeholders across regions and act as a key connector, especially between NA and EMEA.
* Partner with sales, marketing, and customer-facing teams to ensure internal readiness and clear external positioning.



**People & Organizational Leadership** 



* Lead and grow a team of product managers and senior ICs with clarity, support, and high standards.
* Mentor the team through ambiguity, helping raise the bar on execution, ownership, and strategic thinking.
* Foster a culture of empowerment and accountability, ensuring team voices are heard and acted on.
* Partner with leadership peers across functions to drive collaboration and shared ownership of outcomes.
* Identify and resolve organizational gaps, unlocking performance, motivation, and clarity.


**Our hiring process** 

**🌴** 
 We’ll be taking some well-deserved
 **downtime from late July to early August** 
 . So if you’re waiting to hear from us during that time, no need to worry—we’ll keep you updated on progress and pauses throughout the process 🌴
   





 Also, don't waste your time on writing the best possible cover letter for the job. We want you to create an impact that matters, and that's not in the cover letter.
   




* Virtual meet and greet. Meet Henrik Leerberg, SVP of Product Management and the hiring manager for this role.
* Personality-based interview. You will be asked to fill out an online personality assessment using use Hogan prior to the interview. Our Hogan assessment enables us to understand your abilities and how you align with our team culture. Instead of seeking 'appropriate' responses, the priority is to develop a meaningful exchange that illustrates your synergy with the Trackunit team.
* Assignment-specific interview. We want you to get an insight into some of the concrete work tasks or projects related to the role. You will be given a case to prepare prior to the interview, and at the interview, you will present the case to relevant colleagues from across Trackunit, who you’ll also work closely with in the job.
* If needed, throughout the process we will obtain references from former employers and do background checks for level specific, if you have not provided these yourself.
* Offer presentation and walk-through. We’re lucky to have you!


**Coming Together To Connect Construction** 

 We’re committed to construction - one of the largest industries in the world. Over the past two decades, Trackunit has been pioneering technological progress within construction. Today, we are not only a leading IoT provider, but a thought leader, supporting and shaping the agenda for an entire industry on a global scale.
 



 We believe in taking a people approach in everything we do. Being human-centric is not restricted to our products – it’s a way of life at Trackunit. We’re proud to be a truly global team. Our colleagues get together in hubs spread across the globe, but we embrace the idea of working remotely and in environments that inspire you. Everything we do, we do it to eliminate downtime and build the most useful industry for the world.
 



**The question is: Are you in?**

title: System Architect
description:
**About Brite Payments**
 Brite Payments is a leading Open Banking-powered Account to Account (A2A) payment provider of Instant Payments and Instant Payouts. We provide a convenient transaction experience for consumers and reduce the risk in the payment process for merchants.
   

  

 Founded in Stockholm in 2019, Brite is committed to providing the best possible payment solution for everyone involved in a transaction. The team behind Brite has worked with launching the first-generation of fintech companies before founding Brite. We know the market landscape, technologies, opportunities, and challenges.
   

  

 We have grown quite a bit in the last few years and this summer we are looking for a cloud loving architectural enthusiast who loves development, data and building high performance systems.
   

  

 What You'll Work With on a Daily Basis
   

  

 We need you to lead our work in setting our Architectural Vision, building our Architectural Strategy to achieve this vision, and then guiding our Product Development Teams towards building scalable, performant, safe, observable and maintainable systems. We are now laying the foundation for our future growth.
   

  

 We strongly believe the best way to do so is in collaboration and we expect you to be an excellent communicator as well as leader. You will be part of ensuring our autonomous product teams have the guidance and guardrails they need to deliver value.
   

  

 You are not alone in this and as System Architect you are part of the senior leadership in the Product Development organization together with other Product and Engineering leaders.
   

  

 Here's a glimpse into your daily responsibilities:
   

  

**Architectural Direction:** 
 One of your key accountabilities is to own and care for the Architectural Vision, making sure it helps us realize our Company vision.
   

  

**Architectural Guidance:** 
 Using this Vision we can then define the strategy for how to design and build smaller, independent services that are resilient and scalable. You are the go-to expert for architectural patterns, best practices, and anti-patterns.
   

  

**Collaboration with Product Development Teams:** 
 You'll work closely with our agile product-focused development teams, providing architectural reviews, offering technical mentorship, and helping them make informed technology choices. Most of this is done through the Tech Leads who are part of the Architectural Forum which you lead.
   

  

**Partnership with Platform Engineering:** 
 You'll collaborate with our Platform Engineering team, leveraging their GCP expertise to align architectural decisions with platform capabilities and limitations.
   

  

**Data Strategy:** 
 You'll play a crucial role in establishing clear guidelines for data storage, management, and access across our diverse services, ensuring data integrity and optimal performance.
   

  

**Documentation and Visualization:** 
 You'll drive initiatives to improve how we document and visualize our system's architecture and dependencies, making complex systems understandable for all stakeholders.
   

  

 Must-Haves
   

  

**Leadership experience** 
 : While we believe in collaboration and communication as the means to find the best possible path forward, we also need you to be a facilitator of this happening as well as a strong decision maker whenever needed. We have several high impact decisions we need to make over the coming years to make our future journey possible.
   

  

**Experience as a developer:** 
 You’ve been a developer with architectural responsibilities, Systems Architect, Principal Engineer, or held a similar role in a distributed, cloud-native environment. You’ve mentored teams before, and enjoy helping others grow.
   

  

**Extensive experience with distributed systems architecture:** 
 You have a deep understanding of microservices, event-driven architectures, and API design.
   

  

**Strong expertise in Google Cloud Platform (GCP):** 
 You are highly proficient with core GCP services such as Cloud Run, Pub/Sub, Datastore, Cloud SQL, Eventarc, API Gateway, Cloud Storage, and more.
 **Note** 
 : You could also be knowledgeable in GCP while being an expert in for example AWS and Azure, however in that case you need to cover the knowledge gap before coming in on this challenge.
   

  

**Experience in defining and implementing architectural patterns:** 
 You can articulate and guide teams on best practices for building scalable, resilient, and maintainable systems.
   

  

**Excellent communication and collaboration skills:** 
 You can effectively communicate complex technical concepts to diverse audiences and foster a collaborative environment. We also expect you to be fluent in both
 **Swedish** 
 and
 **English** 
 as the communication expectations on this role are set high.
   

  

**Ability to balance autonomy with architectural consistency:** 
 You understand how to enable highly autonomous teams while ensuring architectural coherence.
   

  

 Nice-to-Haves
   

  

**Experience in the FinTech industry:** 
 Familiarity with the unique challenges and requirements of financial services such as payments providers, banks and banking networks.
   

  

**Experience with infrastructure as code (e.g., Terraform):** 
 Understanding of how to manage and provision infrastructure programmatically.
   

  

**Experience with observability and monitoring tools:** 
 Knowledge of how to build and maintain robust monitoring and alerting systems for distributed architectures.
   

  

**Familiarity with various data storage technologies:** 
 Beyond the listed GCP services, experience with other database types (e.g., NoSQL, graph databases).
   

  

 Why Brite?
   

  

* Make an impact – Be part of a fintech innovator redefining payments across Europe.
* Career growth – Access continuous learning programs (Coursera, Google Cloud Skills Boost) and internal mobility opportunities.
* Great culture – A dynamic, supportive team with regular events, breakfasts, and after-works. Enjoy free coffee, fruit, and snacks!
* International environment – Work with a diverse, talented team across multiple European hubs.


 Are you reading this from a folding chair while on vacation? Have a look around, is this the time to join us and have a significant impact on our journey to revolutionize instant payments? We'd love to hear from you!

title: Senior IT Analyst
description:
**Start** 
 : ASAP
   

  

**Location** 
 : Stockholm / Finland
   

  

**Duration** 
 : March 2026
   

  

 We’re looking for an experienced Senior IT Analyst to join our team, specializing in SEPA, SWIFT, ISO 20022 (MT to MX), and payment system transformations. You will bridge IT and business, gathering and detailing requirements, designing process models, and supporting data mapping and migration initiatives.
   

  

**Key responsibilities** 
 :
   

  

* Elicit and analyze business and IT requirements from multiple stakeholders
* Document functional and non-functional requirements in clear requirement specification documents
* Perform data analysis, data mapping and design data flows to support development teams
* Identify impacted systems and teams based on requirements
* Support development and quality control activities to ensure alignment with business objectives
* Build process models and support user interface prototyping and design
* Work hands-on with SQL to analyze and validate data
* Bring strong business knowledge of the payments domain (SEPA, SWIFT, ISO messages) to guide solution design


**Job requirements**
**Requirements**
* Proven experience as an IT Analyst / Requirement Specialist in the payments area
* Strong technical knowledge in data mapping, migration and process modelling
* Hands-on SQL experience
* Deep understanding of payment systems and standards: SEPA, SWIFT, ISO 20022 (MT to MX)
* Experience with user interface prototyping and design
* Familiarity with bulking/de-bulking of payment files, instant payments vs. classic SEPA payments, and customer enrolment processes
* Strong communication skills and ability to work in cross-functional Nordic teams
* Structured, detail-oriented and proactive approach
* Experience in instant payments infrastructure
* Knowledge of bulking/de-bulking files in payment processing
* Prior work on customer enrolment flows for payment systems


**Application procedure**
 A Maandag® recruiter will assess your application as soon as possible to determine whether you are suitable for an open position.
   

  

**About The Company**
 If you are a good match, we would like to receive a CV in WORD format with motivation why you fit this assignment, your availability and any scheduled holidays.
   

  

 Why Maandag Nordic? With us, you’ll get the chance to really put your ideas into action. We offer a work environment where you can grow and learn through hands-on experience - trying things out, making mistakes, and improving.
   

  

 For more than 35 years, Maandag® has been at the forefront of empowering people and organisations. We not only help professionals get jobs, but also connect them with a future that matches their values, desires and ambitions. Because when people are truly in the right place, they can develop themselves, fulfil their dreams and go to work with fresh energy every day. The energy and power released in the process is a catalyst for growth for companies. We started in the Netherlands, but now we also help professionals and organisations in Belgium, Poland, Dubai and Sweden. Our extensive knowledge of different markets, coupled with our wide network, enables us to make perfect matches quickly.

title: Sales Specialist CX
description:
**Join as an Sales Specialist CX in Sweden.** 




 Oracle is leading the digital revolution. We are empowering nearly half a million businesses across the globe to turn untapped potential into real business value. Kick-start your career with some real responsibility and an incredible learning experience.
 



  





 We are looking for an entrepreneurial-style Sales Specialist for Oracle’s CX Specialist Sales team, someone with drive, who will walk through brick walls without having to be asked to achieve whatever goal is in front of them. This role is perfect for someone inherently curious. A person who loves what they do and devours information related to their field, their profession and their craft. They read about it, study it, talk to other people about it... immerse themselves in it, continuously. And work proactively to stay current in it. We are seeking a passionate and talented Sales Specialist CX to join our team in
 **Sweden** 
 to serve the
 **Swedish** 
 market.
 



  





**What you will do** 




 Create Pipeline, Win Pipeline, Forecast Accurately – more in details
 


* Sell our award-winning solutions to high quality accounts in the Enterprise& Mid-Market Segments
* Generate, develop and close new business. Meet or exceed quarterly and annual revenue targets
* Call on senior-level executive contacts (CEO, CFO, SVP, CMO)
* Manage a highly consultative, complex sales cycle
* Work closely with prospective clients to understand their business objectives and create the most appropriate solution to meet their needs
* Work in an International team environment with peers, account managers and sales engineers to retain and grow accounts
* Create and manage territory and account plans
* Engage with our Strategic accounts and prospects at strategic level to drive commercial value
* Develop Industry focused value proposition to position CX solutions as key in delivering business value
* Set up and run discovery customer workshops



  





  





**What You’ll Bring** 




 Your enthusiasm, knowledge, and customer-centricity will help us become the number one cloud company in the world. We also look for:
 


* Ability to offer unique perspective by reframing and challenging the way customers view their business; know how to structure a sales pitch to highlight customer benefits before supplier strengths
* Adopt at driving two way communication by clearly articulating value proposition and teaching to customer’s pain points
* 5 years of minimum CX sales experience
* You understand the decision making process and have the ability to influence key decision makers
* Experience selling high end Software as a Service solutions or consulting services to large enterprises
* Person who is familiar with CX Technologies across Marketing, Sales and Service. The Ideal candidate has knowledge about, CRM, CDP, MarTech, AdTech and Data.
* Authorised to work in the Netherlands
* Fluent English and Swedish is required



  





  





**Why Join Oracle?** 



* **Competitive Salary and Benefits** 
 : Enjoy a comprehensive compensation package with attractive benefits.
* **Career Growth** 
 : Access world-class learning and development opportunities to advance your career.
* **Supportive, Inclusive Culture** 
 : Join an inclusive culture that celebrates individuality and encourages diversity.
* **Comprehensive Wellbeing Support** 
 : Take advantage of our Employee Assistance Program and health resources.
* **Core Benefits** 
 : Including life insurance, retirement planning, and more



  





 Apply now!

title: Manager of Digital Transformation & IT Product Management
description:
**Why Join Us?**
 We’re on a mission to empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. As the world-leader in assistive communication solutions, we empower our customers to express themselves, connect with the world, and live richer lives.
   

  

 At Tobii Dynavox, you can grow your career within a dynamic, global company that has a clear, impactful purpose - with the flexibility to also do what truly matters to you outside of work. What’s more, you’ll be part of a work culture where collaboration is the norm and individuality is welcomed.
   

  

 As a member of our team, you’ll have the power to grow ideas in an unconventional environment. At the same time, you’ll work in a culture of ongoing learning and development, allowing you to constantly expand your area of expertise.
   

  

 The Manager of Digital Transformation & IT Product Management is a visionary leadership role responsible for personally spearheading Dynavox Group's digital transformation efforts while managing internal IT product portfolios. This role goes beyond traditional management to directly identify, conceptualize, and champion innovative digital opportunities across the organization. While overseeing IT Product Managers and Digitalization Managers, this leader will actively drive the discovery and execution of transformative digital solutions, streamline operations, and revolutionize business processes through technology. The ideal candidate will be both a hands-on innovator and a strategic leader who proactively shapes the company's digital future.
   

  

 In this role you would report to the Head of Information Technology and be part of the IT management team. The role is based in Stockholm but important stakeholders, as well as some team members, are based in Pittsburgh. Some travel, although not extensive, can be expected.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Identify, conceptualize, and champion digital transformation opportunities throughout the organization. Proactively seek out areas for automation, process optimization, and digital innovation that support business goals.
* Actively scout emerging technologies and market trends to develop visionary digital strategies that provide competitive advantages. Challenge the status quo and drive forward-thinking approaches to business challenges.
* Engage directly in solution design workshops, proof-of-concept development, and innovation sprints to drive breakthrough digital solutions.
* Manage and mentor a diverse team while fostering a culture of experimentation and innovation. Lead by example as an active participant in ideation and solution development.
* Build stakeholder and executive-level relationships to identify untapped opportunities for digital innovation. Act as the bridge between business needs and technological possibilities.
* Shape and champion a comprehensive digital transformation roadmap and product portfolio strategy, ensuring the timely delivery of solutions that improve efficiency, scalability, and business performance.


**Required Skills and Qualifications:**
* Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Business, Digital Innovation, or a related field (Master's preferred).
* 10+ years of experience in IT product management, digital transformation, or related fields, with 5+ years in a leadership role.
* Proven track record of personally identifying and successfully implementing large-scale digital transformation initiatives in a complex enterprise environment.
* Strong leadership skills with experience managing cross-functional teams.
* Hands-on understanding of modern technology stacks, digital platforms, cloud solutions, and enterprise software.
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to influence and drive change across all levels of the organization.


**Preferred Qualifications:**
* Experience personally leading digital transformation across multiple business domains (e.g., HR, Finance, Operations, Customer Service).
* Experience designing and building innovative solutions in Salesforce is a plus.
* Demonstrated innovation portfolio with examples of personally conceived and implemented digital solutions.


- 

**Apply today!**
 We believe in empowering individuals - including our own employees - to reach their full potential. So, if you want to change lives while growing your own career, we’d love to hear from you.

title: Teknisk projektledare
description:
**Uppdraget:**
 Projekten innefattar samordning mellan Beställarens interna nätverkstjänstleverantör och en extern leverantör, för att säkerställa en smidig och säker övergång av Beställarens nätverkssystem, samt arbete kopplat till medicinteknisk utrustning och system som AVK (audiovisuell kommunikation), DMD (digital medicinsk dokumentation), telefonkommunikation och andra system.
   

  

 Tekniska projektledaren kommer att arbeta nära Beställarens förvaltare av olika tillämpningar, change manager och vårdpersonal. Tekniska Projektledaren kommer också att ingå i projektets styrgrupp och kontinuerligt informera sjukhusets ledning om projektets framsteg och riskhantering.
   

  

 Den Tekniska projektledarens arbetsuppgifter kommer bland annat innefatta:
   

  

* Leda och hantera både migreringprojektet mot den interna molnlösningen samt nätverksmigreringsprojektet från initiering till slutförande, inklusive planering, genomförande, övervakning och avslutning.
* Koordinera och kommunicera effektivt med interna och externa nätverksleverantörer för att säkerställa att alla tekniska krav och specifikationer uppfylls.
* Samarbeta med Beställarens förvaltare av olika tillämpningar för att säkerställa att alla system och applikationer är kompatibla med det nya nätverket.
* Arbeta nära change manager för att säkerställa att alla förändringar hanteras effektivt och att risker minimeras.
* Engagera och involvera vårdpersonal i projektets olika faser för att säkerställa att deras behov och krav beaktas.
* Säkerställa att medicinteknisk utrustning och annan relevant utrustning integreras och fungerar korrekt med det nya nätverkssystemet.
* Utveckla och upprätthålla detaljerade projektplaner, budgetar och statusrapporter för att hålla alla intressenter informerade om projektets framsteg.
* Identifiera och hantera risker och problem som kan påverka projektets framgång.
* Organisera och leda regelbundna projektmöten för att främja samarbete och problemlösning.


**SKA-krav:**
* Minst fem (5) års erfarenhet av Teknisk projektledning inom hälso- och sjukvårdssektorn.
* Anses som expert inom området, 9-12 års erfarenhet som Teknisk projektledare
* Erfarenhet av att leda migreringprojekt och nätverksmigreringsprojekt.
* Erfarenhet av medicinteknisk utrustning och dess integration med nätverkssystem
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med AVK, DMD, telefonkommunikationssystem eller motsvarande system
* Relevant akademisk utbildning om lägst 120 högskolepoäng inom IT, teknik eller annat relevant område.
* Certifiering inom projektledning (t.ex. PMP, PRINCE2).
* God förmåga att uttrycka sig i svenska och engelska i tal och skrift
* Två (2) referensuppdrag som Teknisk projektledare


**Omfattning:** 
 100%
   

  

**Placeringsort:** 
 Stockholm
   

  

**Avtalstid** 
 omgående - 2026-06-30 (med option på förlängning, maximalt 12 månader)
   

  

**Svarstid och svarssätt:**
 Vi ser fram -emot din intresseanmälan
 **senast 2025-07-06** 
 innehållande:
   

  

* CV på svenska i Word format
* Referensuppdrag
* Översikt över kravuppfyllnad ska-krav med tydlig beskrivning av kunskaper, erfarenhet inom relevant område samt referensuppdrag
* Önskat timpris

title: Solutions Architect
description:
**Description**
 As a Solutions Architect at AWS, you’ll build technical relationships with customers of all sizes and operate as their trusted advisor, ensuring they get the most out of the cloud at every stage of their journey.
   

  

 You’ll manage the overall technical relationship between AWS and our customers, making recommendations on security, cost, performance, reliability and operational efficiency to accelerate their challenging projects. Internally, you will be the voice of the customer, sharing their needs and wants to inform the roadmap of AWS features. In this role, your creativity will link technology to tangible solutions, with the opportunity to implement cloud-native reference architectures for a variety of use cases.
   

  

 You will participate in the creation and sharing of best practices, technical content and new reference architectures (e.g. white papers, code samples, blog posts) and evangelize and educate about AWS technology (e.g. through workshops, user groups, meetups, public speaking, online videos or conferences).
   

  

 If you can educate AWS customers about the art of the possible, while challenging the impossible, come build the future with us.
   

  

 This role is within the Sweden organization and you would be working with Enterprise customers.
   

  

 Come build the future with us.
   

  

 AWS Global Sales drives adoption of the AWS cloud worldwide, enabling customers of all sizes to innovate and expand in the cloud. Our team empowers every customer to grow by providing tailored service, unmatched technology, and unwavering support. We dive deep to understand each customer's unique challenges, then craft innovative solutions that accelerate their success. This customer-first approach is how we built the world's most adopted cloud. Join us and help us grow.
   

  

**About The Team**
 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS?
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 AWS values curiosity and connection. Our employee-led and company-sponsored affinity groups promote inclusion and empower our people to take pride in what makes us unique. Our inclusion events foster stronger, more collaborative teams. Our continual innovation is fueled by the bold ideas, fresh perspectives, and passionate voices our teams bring to everything we do.
   

  

 Mentorship & Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
 Experience within specific technology domain areas (e.g. software development, cloud computing, systems engineering, infrastructure, security, networking, data & analytics).
   

  

 Experience in design, implementation, or consulting in applications and infrastructures
   

  

 Bachelor's degree, HAVO diploma or equivalent
   

  

 Fluent written and verbal communication skills in English
   

  

**Preferred Qualifications**
 Experience working within software development or Internet-related industries
   

  

 Experience migrating or transforming legacy customer solutions to the cloud
   

  

 Experience with AWS technologies
   

  

 Cloud Technology Certification (such as Solutions Architecture, Cloud Security Professional or Cloud DevOps Engineering)
   

  

 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - AWS EMEA SARL (Sweden Branch) - G54
   

  

 Job ID: A3021742

title: Awareness and communication specialist (Information & Cyber Security)
description:
**Job Description**
**Role Overview:**
 We are seeking a dynamic and hands-on
 **Awareness and Communication Specialist** 
 to drive global cybersecurity culture change through targeted awareness initiatives, nano learning, phishing simulations, and crisis exercises. This role is central to building human cyber resilience across our global automotive enterprise.
   

  

 You will work with cutting-edge platforms such as
 **Hoxhunt** 
 and
 **Immersive Labs** 
 , develop engaging content, and support our internal security academy. Your mission: to reduce human risk and strengthen the organization’s ability to identify, prevent, and respond to cyber threats.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
**Cybersecurity Awareness & Nano Learning**
* Plan, create, and manage short, high-impact nano learning modules tailored to diverse employee groups and risk areas
* Develop engaging, scenario-based content to build security habits around phishing, password hygiene, remote work, and other key topics
* Localize and adapt content for cultural and regional relevance across global teams
* Phishing Simulation & Human Risk Management
* Design and run targeted phishing simulation campaigns using Hoxhunt and other platforms
* Analyse user behaviour and metrics to continuously improve awareness and resilience
* Collaborate with departments (e.g., HR, Legal, IT) to ensure campaigns align with internal policies and regulations
* Crisis Simulation & Cyber Drills
* Coordinate and facilitate cyber crisis simulations and tabletop exercises using Immersive Labs or similar platforms
* Develop custom scenarios based on threat intelligence and risk assessments
* Support post-exercise reporting, debriefs, and action plans for improvement
* Academy & Internal Content Creation
* Support the Information Security Academy with relevant learning paths, microlearning assets, videos, and interactive materials
* Create content for awareness campaigns (e.g., Cybersecurity Month), newsletters, intranet, posters, and digital signage
* Maintain knowledge portals, toolkits, and internal LMS content


**Key Qualifications**
* Bachelor's degree in Communications, Cybersecurity, Instructional Design, Behavioural Science, or related field
* 3–5+ years of experience in cybersecurity awareness, learning and development, or digital communications in a complex global organization
* Proven experience working with platforms such as Hoxhunt, Immersive Labs, LMS systems, and content design tools (e.g., Articulate, Adobe Creative Suite, Canva)
* Strong understanding of cybersecurity fundamentals and user-focused threat vectors (phishing, social engineering, insider risk)


**Preferred Skills**
* Understanding of automotive industry cyber standards (e.g., ISO/SAE 21434, TISAX, NIST CSF)
* Certifications like SSAP (Security Awareness and Culture Professional), CompTIA Security+, or GCCC (GIAC Critical Controls Certification) are a plus
* Ability to analyse data and translate insights into engaging, data-driven awareness strategies


**Personal Attributes**
* Creative, curious, and passionate about shaping cyber-safe behaviours
* Exceptional communication and storytelling skills – both written and visual
* Organized and detail-oriented with the ability to manage multiple campaigns and deliverables simultaneously
* Comfortable working across time zones and cultures in a global enterprise


**Why Join Us?**
 Be part of a leading global automotive company at the forefront of connected mobility and cybersecurity. You’ll have the opportunity to innovate, influence culture, and make a measurable impact on how thousands of employees worldwide think and act on security.
   

  

 At DXC Technology, we believe strong connections and community are key to our success. Our work model prioritizes in-person collaboration while offering flexibility to support wellbeing, productivity, individual work styles, and life circumstances. We’re committed to fostering an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive.
   

  

 Recruitment fraud is a scheme in which fictitious job opportunities are offered to job seekers typically through online services, such as false websites, or through unsolicited emails claiming to be from the company. These emails may request recipients to provide personal information or to make payments as part of their illegitimate recruiting process. DXC does not make offers of employment via social media networks and DXC never asks for any money or payments from applicants at any point in the recruitment process, nor ask a job seeker to purchase IT or other equipment on our behalf. More information on employment scams is available here
 *.*

title: Dagab söker Varuflödesutvecklare
description:
Dagab skapar, lagerhåller och levererar sortimentet till Axfoodkoncernens kedjor såsom bl a Hemköp, Willys, City Gross, Snabbgross, Urban Deli och Apohem. Vi utvecklar också egna varumärken, bl.a. Garant, Eldorado och Såklart. Vår verksamhet vilar på goda värderingar för jord, människa och samhälle, vilket genomsyrar allt från sortimentsutveckling, paketering och transport - till hur vi agerar mot våra medarbetare. På så sätt ger vi våra kunder förutsättningar att göra schyssta, hållbara val.
   

  

 Med andra ord - hos oss är du med och påverkar det vardagliga livet för en sisådär tio miljoner människor, förstå hur viktiga våra medarbetare är för oss. Välkommen du med!
   

  

**Bli en av oss**
 Som Varuflödesutvecklare kommer du bli en del av teamet Varuflödesutveckling som är en del av Dagabs Varuflödesstyrning. Du kommer främst arbeta tillsammans med samtliga avdelningar inom Varuflödesstyrning men även ha kontakt brett inom övriga Dagab och Axfood.
   

  

 Varuflödesstyrning på Dagab består, utöver varuflödesutveckling, av avdelningar för efterfrågeplanering, varuflödesförhandling, varuflödesplanering av flödet in till lager och ut till butik samt support till Axfoods marknadskoncept och externa företagskunder. Varuflödesutveckling stöttar avdelningarna inom varuflödesstyrning med analys, rapportstöd och utveckling.
   

  

**Det här får du göra**
 Som Varuflödesutvecklare får du en bred roll med stor möjlighet att påverka Varuflödesstyrnings arbetsmetoder och prestation. Du leder och deltar i projekt och aktiviteter, kartlägger och utvecklar våra processer samt analyserar löpande våra varuflöden.
   

  

 I uppdraget för avdelningen varuflödesutveckling ingår att:
   

  

* Löpande analysera, utvärdera och utveckla varuflödet
* Utveckla, automatisera och optimera arbetsprocesser och rutiner som används av de olika avdelningarna
* Förvalta och utveckla rapporter som används av de olika avdelningarna för att följa upp varuflödet
* Utföra analyser och kravställa utveckling av modeller som hjälper varuflödesstyrningen att ta mer datadrivna beslut
* Projektleda större och mindre uppdrag för att förbättra varuflödet
* Ansvara för metoder för ständiga förbättringar inom varuflödesstyrning


 Utmaningarna är många i vår vardag och i den föränderliga omvärld vi befinner oss i behöver vi alltid arbeta för att skapa flexibilitet i varuflödet samtidigt som vi bibehåller effektivitet. För att hitta lösningar som på bästa sätt säkerställer Dagabs konkurrenskraft behöver du samverka med många olika funktioner och bygga ett stort nätverk inom organisationen.
   

  

**Det här förväntar vi oss**
 Vi söker dig som har en högskoleutbildning inom logistik, supply chain eller annat närliggande område. Till det har du arbetslivserfarenhet inom logistik och en god förståelse av varuflödestyrning med fokus på analys och utveckling av processer. Du navigerar vant i analysverktyg och rapporter och har god förmåga att kommunicera.
   

  

 Som person är du utvecklingsorienterad och strukturerad och har förmåga att ta ansvar och leda arbetet framåt inom tilldelade ansvarsområden och uppdrag. Du har en god samarbets- och kommunikationsförmåga som möjliggör ett gott samarbetsklimat samt besitter förmågan att kunna strukturera och tolka information för att kunna se mönster och samband.
   

  

 Erfarenhet av arbete i BI system, inköpssystem, SQL och programmeringskunskaper är meriterande samt erfarenhet av kravprocesser och förmåga att ställa krav mot IT och verksamhetsutveckling är meriterande.
   

  

 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning med start så snart som möjligt eller enligt överenskommelse. Placering är på vårt huvudkontor, Torsplan Stockholm. Om du vill veta mer om vad tjänsten innebär, kontakta Jacob Levy, jacob.levy@dagab.se som kan svara på frågor efter den 28 juli. Vi ser gärna att du vid intresse skickar din ansökan så snart som möjligt, då tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas före sista ansökningsdag den 2025-08-22. Vi tar endast emot ansökningar via våra jobbsidor.
   

  

*För att ta reda på om just du är den vi söker så innehåller vår rekryteringsprocess både tester och intervjuer.*
*Vi gör även bakgrundskontroll vid samtliga rekryteringar. Läs mer:* 
 Så går det till när du söker jobb inom Axfood
   

  

 Observera att vi inte under denna rekryteringsprocess kommer be dig logga in med ditt Bank-id eller scanna någon QR-kod. Vid frågor kontakta Medarbetarsupporten på jobb@axfood.se.
   

  

**Om Dagab Inköp & Logistik**
 Dagab driver och utvecklar koncernens sortiment, inköp och logistik. Dagab har en nyckelroll i Axfoods arbete med att ständigt effektivisera varuflödet. Dagab omsätter drygt 74 miljarder kronor (2023) och ingår i Axfood AB som är noterat på Nasdaq OMX Stockholm AB:s Large Cap-lista.
   

  

 Dagab är en del av Axfood, vårt gemensamma uppdrag hittar du om du klickar här.

title: Senior Business Expert - Checkout & Pay
description:
**Job Description**
**WHAT YOU’LL DO**
 As a Senior Business Expert within our Retail Tech team, you will play a key role in shaping the future of H&M Group’s in-store checkout and payment experience. This is a strategic and hands-on role where you’ll work across teams and markets to drive innovation, improve customer journeys, and support the transformation of our global Checkout solutions.
   

  

* Drive the product strategy for checkout and payment solutions across H&M Group’s global retail operations.
* Collaborate closely with product managers, business experts, and tech teams to define requirements, evaluate product performance, and implement improvements.
* Be a vital part in our POS transformation by setting requirements and supporting our transformation initiatives.
* Act as a key link between retail and our tech function, with the responsibility to capture and define technical requirements that align with business needs.


**Who You’ll Work With**
 You’ll be part of a passionate and collaborative cross-functional team within the Retail Tech area of the Customer Development & Growth function. This team brings together expertise in product management, business analysis, design, and data to shape the future of our in-store checkout and payment experience. You’ll collaborate with colleagues across different regions and time zones, reflecting the global nature of both our organization and the solutions we build.
   

  

**Who You Are**
*We are looking for people with…*
* A Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, IT, Engineering, or a related field.
* A background in business development or product development, ideally within the consumer retail industry.
* Experience working with data-heavy, logical products and a strong interest in IT systems and customer experience.
* Experience with change management and user training methodologies.
* Familiarity with POS and payment solutions is a bonus


*And people who are…*
* Analytical, structured, and data-driven, with a genuine interest in improving retail experiences.
* Proactive and self-driven, with the ability to manage multiple priorities and work independently.
* Curious, open-minded, and eager to contribute to a collaborative and inclusive team culture.
* Passionate about agile ways of working, with experience in Scrum and tools like Jira, and comfortable collaborating across global teams


**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

 Commercial Development & Growth is a global function within the H&M brand and our mission is to set and deliver on the global customer experience strategy to strengthen our brand and enable profitable sales. Together we develop, expand and optimize all sales channels while securing conditions for efficient operations leveraged by tech and strong collaboration across the organization. Our function plays a key role in delivering on our brand plan through an elevated, inspirational, and relevant shopping experience that is centred around our product and provides competitive convenience for our customers.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  

* All our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program (HIP)
* All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound.
* 30 days holiday
* We offer a collective agreement which includes pension and life insurance
* Wellness benefit 3000kr/year
* Access to Benify Benefits Portal
* Communities with activities


**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  

* We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.

title: Strategist
description:
**Company Description**
*Publicis Groupe is one of the largest communications groups in the world. We are building the agency model of the future and take a holistic approach to our clients’ challenges. By fusing together our media, creative, data and technology expertise, we are able to provide clients with integrated solutions, transformative ideas and compelling consumer experiences. We call it the Power of One.*
*We are proud winner of many awards and nominations, both in Sweden and internationally. But nothing makes us prouder than to work with clients and brands such as* 
*P&G, Disney, H&M, Mondelez, Volvo, VISA, Lantmännen, LEGO, Spotify, Perrigo, Renault and many more.*
*At Publicis, we put our people first. We are proud to be certified by Great Place to Work (2022, 2023, 2024, 2025), and have been recognized with a Magnet Award for our engaging culture (2023). Our goal is to become the leading workplace in our industry. We are based in a fantastic office in Odenplan, but also offer a flexible work policy.*
**Overview**
 We are now looking for a Strategist to work closely together with our strategy team. This is a group role that spans across both Media, Digital and Creative, with focus on Media.
   

  

 As a Strategist at Publicis Groupe you will maintain a holistic perspective on how to grow our client’s business looking at marketing at large with focus on effectiveness. Creating perfect alignment between insight- and strategy and how that is best executed in a consistent and coherent way in the activities and channels that will maximize the highest effect. You are integral to client teams and run ‘day to day’ with some guidance. Specialists and account leads look for you to help them with briefing and de-briefing, give strategic direction and prioritize or to prove an argument. Management knows you can be trusted to establish and substantiate a point of view.
   

  

 As Strategist you will also play a crucial role in acquiring new business. Focus is on ensuring consistent and high-quality strategic work to make sure we win, keep and grow business.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Strategic direction and recommendations for clients and in pitches, with focus on media.’
* Acting as a driving force in winning new business, ensuring consistent and high-quality strategic work into local, Nordic and international pitches to ensure we win new business.
* Collaborate with client leadership to ensure the quality of our strategic output on our current clients.Lean in on key clients as the Strategic Lead and build strong relationships as a trusted advisor - this to strengthen our position as a strategic partner (and thereby improve retention and increase satisfaction scores).
* Working closely together with the Global Strategy Team on our strategic product and implement the use of global frameworks, processes, models, tools and products locally.
* Design, package and promote services/communication solutions and ways of working (Power of One) that drives client value and provide business growth for us as a group.
* Keep up to date with trends (market, brand, consumer, media, tech etc) and the latest marketing science. Ensure that the client teams and our clients are informed and inspired about the latest trends and research. Inspire and coach agency teams to be better planners and strategists and ensure they are trained in the network’s strategic frameworks, models, processes and tools.
* Build agency reputation across the industry and within the marketing community. Strengthen our position as a leader when it comes to strategy through e.g. thought leadership pieces, PR, seminars, strategic partnerships, newsletters etc.
* Be a key player internally when it comes to creating award winning work. Support agency teams in compiling agency submissions to industry awards.


**Qualifications**
**Who are you?**
 We believe you are the missing piece - people count on you to add value to any strategic and/or creative argument. You are the expert on all aspects of media & comms strategy and aware of all latest trends and developments. Interest reaches broader than the daily campaign management and aims to drive strategic direction and innovation putting us at the front of the most clever use of media x creativity.
   

  

**Craft Skills**
**Research**
* Master in analytical thinking and drawing conclusions of research reports;
* Understand media-reports and analysis;
* Great understanding and practical skillset of AI and AI tools


**Strategy**
* Ability to use data and insights to form clear strategy direction and prioritization;
* Challenge clients in their objectives and strategies;
* Writing clear strategy presentations with a point of view;
* Master in writing debriefs;
* Writing case-studies;


**Presence**
* Excellent presentation skills;
* Command the room: make people listen to your ideas;
* Run workshops.


**Your qualities & competencies are**
* Be a great sparring partner for your clients;
* Write decks with good narratives;
* Oversee key projects independently;
* Master of debrief and creative brief;
* Curious mindset at all times;
* Out-of-the-box thinker.


 We are taking some time off during the summer period (June-August), so there might be a delay in response regarding your application. Thank you in advance for your patience!
   

  

**Additional Information**
 In addition to a welcoming culture and inclusive environment with passionate colleagues we offer you:
   

  

**Career Opportunities**
 Local and Global opportunities through the Power Of One.
   

  

**Personal and Professional Learning**
 Global AI learning platform where you can participate in +30 000 classes and connect with colleagues from all over the world.
   

  

**Flexible Ways of Working**
 We want to be an employer where work life balance is cherished. We love to spend time with our colleagues at the office but also believe in the output of your work not where the work is being done.
   

  

**Work Your World**
 For six weeks a year, the world is yours. Every employee can work anywhere on the planet where there's a Publicis office. A new city, a favorite locale, or even a different country - Go. Grow. Explore.
   

  

**Mental Health**
 The happiness and health of our people is paramount to us. We work continuously on maintaining a healthy and safe working environment through initiatives that facilitate the well-being of our employees.
   

  

**Benefits**
 Generous benefit package.
   

  

 We look forward to your application!

title: IT-Säkerhetsspecialist - senior  (Stockholm)
description:
Kustbevakningen är en civil statlig beredskapsmyndighet som ansvarar för sjöövervakning och miljöräddningstjänst till sjöss på uppdrag av regering och riksdag. Under beredskapen för miljöräddning arbetar vi förebyggande med miljöövervakning, samtidigt som vi främjar en hållbar havsmiljö. Vi bedriver även tillsyn och kontroll av fiske, tull, gräns, jakt och naturvård till sjöss. Dessutom arbetar vi för att öka tryggheten genom sjötrafikövervakning och har ständig beredskap för sjöräddning. Dygnet runt, året om finns vi på plats längs Sveriges kust, där vi skyddar liv och miljö, nu och för framtiden. Kustbevakningen är en arbetsplats som präglas av samarbete och engagemang över områdesgränserna. Här finns engagerade medarbetare med varierande kompetenser vilket skapar en dynamisk arbetsplats med ständiga möjligheter att lära nytt. Kustbevakningen arbetar med och har stort fokus på medarbetarskap och ledarskap och det är därför viktigt att din värdegrund stämmer överens med Kustbevakningens – helhetssyn, välvilja och engagemang. Kustbevakningen erbjuder en attraktiv arbetsplats som utmärks av strävan att vara fri från diskriminering och ge lika möjligheter och rättigheter till alla.
   

  

**Beskrivning**
 Hos Kustbevakningen finns en relativt nybildad enhet som enbart fokuserar på IT-säkerheten. Vi söker nu juniora IT-säkerhetsspecialister för att fortsätta bygga vårt team och vår förmåga att kunna skydda och upprätthålla en robusthet i Kustbevakningens IT-miljö.
   

  

 Kustbevakningen har en viktig roll i totalförsvaret där IT-säkerhet och cybersäkerhet är en viktig del av allt vi gör. Som IT-säkerhetsspecialist kommer du bidra till att på olika sätt hantera IT-säkerhetsbrister och bygga en säkrare IT-miljö. Det innebär att du som specialist stödjer myndigheten med din kompetens inom området Cyber och IT-säkerhet och driver arbete framåt för att Kustbevakningen bättre skall vara rustade för framtida utmaningar och hot. Du bidrar med att skapa en effektiv och samtidigt säker arbetsmiljö både ombord på våra fartyg, flyg, fordon och kontor.
   

  

*Denna annons avser samma tjänst som annonsen med ref.nr 2025/213 med arbetsort Karlskrona.*
*Sök jobbet här* 
 : https://kustbevakningen.varbi.com/se/what:job/jobID:842179/
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
 Du har ett nära samarbete med specialister inom IT-säkerhet, informationssäkerhet, arkitekter, systemägare inom Kustbevakningen och deltar i samverkan med andra myndigheter och i kontakt med olika leverantörer.
   

  

 Du kan antingen få jobba som:
   

  

**Analytiker** 
 , som kontinuerligt övervakar och analyserar både externa och interna säkerhetshot och sårbarheter för att identifiera potentiella risker, attacker och att upptäcka mönster och anomalier. Samt att kunna hantera IT-säkerhetsincidenter och skapa underlag som tydligt kommunicerar säkerhetsläget och rekommenderade åtgärder.
   

  

**Förvaltare** 
 , säkerställer att Kustbevakningens IT-säkerhetsinfrastruktur fungerar effektivt och är uppdaterad, samt övervakar funktionaliteten, konfigurerar och optimerar systemen på bästa sätt. Sker i ett tätt samarbeta med övriga enheter och team på IT för att säkerställa att säkerhetssystemen integreras smidigt med organisationens övriga OT/IT-infrastruktur.
   

  

**Penetrationstestare** 
 , dessa arbetsuppgifter handlar om att genomföra tester för att identifiera sårbarheter i Kustbevakningens OT/IT-miljö. I rollen ingår att dokumentera och analysera resultaten från tester och undersökningar samt att skapa detaljerade rapporter som beskriver upptäckta sårbarheter och rekommenderade åtgärder för att åtgärda bristerna.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
 Vi söker dig som har:
   

  

* Lämplig eftergymnasial utbildning med inriktning som vi bedömer relevant, alternativt motsvarande kunskap inhämtad genom arbetslivserfarenhet.
* Flerårig och gedigen kunskap inom området.
* Mycket god förmåga att dokumentera och rapportera samt att utveckla och förklara problemställningar och hitta konstruktiva och säkra lösningar.
* Mycket god förmåga att leda och koordinera projekt, uppdrag, implementationer, incidenter etc.
* Djupgående kunskaper inom IT-säkerhetssystem och -verktyg.
* Djupgående förståelse för säkerhetsprotokoll och -standarder.
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.


 Meriterande är erfarenhet av:
   

  

* Mentorskap och att utbilda juniora personer.
* Arbete inom en myndighet.
* Erfarenhet av att hantera och åtgärda komplexa säkerhetsincidenter.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med ledningsgruppen för att kommunicera säkerhetsrisker och rekommendationer.
* Relevanta certifieringar.


 Vi värdesätter din förmåga att arbeta både självständigt och i team, samt din kapacitet att kommunicera komplexa säkerhetsfrågor på ett tydligt och begripligt sätt. Du är analytisk, lösningsorienterad och har en stark förmåga att identifiera och hantera säkerhetsrisker. Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper och förmågor.
   

  

 Tester kommer användas i urvalet.
   

  

**Villkor**
 Anställningen är tillsvidare med sex månaders provanställning och tillträde enligt överenskommelse. Placeringsort är antingen Karlskrona, Göteborg eller Stockholm. Det geografiska arbetsområdet är hela Sverige och tjänsteresor ingår i anställningen. Kustbevakningen medverkar i utlandsuppdrag och internationella insatser. I anställningen ingår därför en skyldighet att tjänstgöra utomlands i de fall det krävs för verksamheten.
   

  

 För anställning krävs svenskt medborgarskap, körkort för personbil, drogtest samt säkerhetsprövning enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen. Vid tillsvidareanställning medföljer även en skyldighet att krigsplaceras.
   

  

 Övrigt För att kvalitetssäkra och effektivisera rekryteringsarbetet använder vi ett elektroniskt ansökningsformulär i samarbete med Varbi för samtliga lediga jobb. Fyll i din ansökan så omsorgsfullt som möjligt för att ge en rättvisande bild av dig själv. Kustbevakningen är en statlig myndighet och det innebär att uppgifterna som du lämnar till oss kan komma att lämnas ut enligt offentlighetsprincipen. Normalt gäller ingen sekretess för de uppgifter som behandlas i databasen. Om du har skyddade personuppgifter ska du kontakta den kontaktperson som finns angiven i annonsen. Inför rekryteringsarbetet har Kustbevakningen tagit ställning till rekryteringskanaler och marknadsföring. Vi undanber oss därför bestämt kontakt med mediesäljare, rekryteringssajter och liknande.
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 2 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100 % | Ort: Stockholm | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2025/218 | Kontakt: Mats Dufva 08-57897565, | Facklig företrädare: SACO/SRAT, TULL-KUST och Seko kontaktas via Kustbevakningens växel 0776-707000, | Publicerat: 2025-07-01 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-08-10

title: Data Analyst
description:
**Start:** 
 ASAP
   

  

**Location** 
 : Stockholm / Finland
   

  

**Duration** 
 : One year
   

  

 We’re looking for a proactive and analytical Data Analyst to join our data team. You’ll bridge business and IT, ensuring that our data-driven solutions add real value to stakeholders. This role is central to understanding business processes, designing data models, and supporting development teams with investigative data analysis and system design.
   

  

**Key responsibilities:**
* Perform IT analysis, investigative data analysis, and system design to support development teams
* Lead or facilitate functional and non-functional requirements gathering, working with multiple stakeholders to design sustainable solutions
* Act as the bridge between IT and business teams to ensure alignment and transparency of requirements
* Build a contextual understanding of business processes and the technical landscape of our solutions
* Develop a deep understanding of the data model, how it’s consumed by development teams, and ensure it meets business requirements within our IIS area
* Collaborate with cross-border, cross-cultural, virtual teams following agile ways of working


**Job requirements**
**Requirements:**
* Experience in relational database design and querying, including performance optimization
* Familiarity with Big Data platforms: Hadoop, Hive, Impala, pySpark, HQL
* Experience working with JSON/AVRO data formats
* Experience with standardized data models (e.g., Canonical Data Model)
* Experience defining and documenting business and technical requirements in a clear format
* Knowledge of at least one programming language: Python, R, or Java
* Experience using tools like Jira (project tracking) and Bitbucket (version control)
* Previous experience collaborating with development teams (developers, architects, IT analysts)
* Familiarity with agile ways of working
* Swedish and English is a must, Finish is a plus.


**Application procedure**
 A Maandag® recruiter will assess your application as soon as possible to determine whether you are suitable for an open position.
   

  

**About The Company**
 If you are a good match, we would like to receive a CV in WORD format with motivation why you fit this assignment, your availability and any scheduled holidays.
   

  

 Why Maandag Nordic? With us, you’ll get the chance to really put your ideas into action. We offer a work environment where you can grow and learn through hands-on experience - trying things out, making mistakes, and improving.
   

  

 For more than 35 years, Maandag® has been at the forefront of empowering people and organisations. We not only help professionals get jobs, but also connect them with a future that matches their values, desires and ambitions. Because when people are truly in the right place, they can develop themselves, fulfil their dreams and go to work with fresh energy every day. The energy and power released in the process is a catalyst for growth for companies. We started in the Netherlands, but now we also help professionals and organisations in Belgium, Poland, Dubai and Sweden. Our extensive knowledge of different markets, coupled with our wide network, enables us to make perfect matches quickly.

title: Head of Technology Finance Management
description:
**Job ID: 30118**
 We are looking for a Head of Technology Finance Management who has an experience in Finance Business Partner role with a robust understanding of Technology. You will lead and support the finance and performance management agenda of Group Technology, participate in setting the strategic direction to meet financial and business targets and facilitate planning, identification of cost drivers and impacts to business stakeholders.
   

  

**About Our Team**
 As part of Group Finance, the Tech Financial Partnering team is the trusted advisor and strategic finance partner to Group Technology and its stakeholders at Nordea. You will join a team of dedicated and experienced Finance Partners with a global footprint across Sweden, Denmark, Norway and Poland. With ample opportunities to improve and establish new ways of working, you will have a truly rewarding journey at Nordea.
